info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 7:47PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Obion and northeastern Lake Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 746 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clayton, or 9 miles southwest of Hickman, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Woodland Mills, Roneys Store, Spout Springs, Walnut Log, Old Fremont, Grays Camp, New Markham, Fremont, Crystal and Reelfoot National Wildlife Refuge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
